sim.author: Richard Harrison, Enrique Laso - Alexis Bory

help.title: Grumman F-14

key.name: Ctrl-o
key.desc: Toggle oversweep (on ground only, otherwise sweep is automatic)

key.name: h
key.desc: Cycle through HSD modes: radar - compas - ECM (RWR)

key.name: Ctrl-n
key.desc: Toggle Radar PULSE SRCH / TWS AUTO Mode

key.name: Ctrl-v
key.desc: Back to Pilot's View or toggle Pilot's and RIO View.

key.name: Ctrl-v
key.desc: Back to Pilot's View or toggle Pilot's and RIO View.

help.line: The menu Fuel and Sores is located in Menu > Tomcat Controls dropdown. (Hit F10 if needed)
Engine start: Ensure sufficient fuel and both engines cut off (glare panel), select R Crank from engine control panel (Next to throttles). At 20% RPM push in cut off for R engine.
Repeat procedure for L engine, you can use quickstart from the menu once you have fuel loaded.
Take off: MILthrust, rotate at 130-160Kts depending on configuration. Do not exceed 10 degrees of pitch
Autopilot:
SAS: Pitch, Roll, Yaw damping controlled by AFCS STAB AUG switches underneath engine controls
Yaw damper must be on over Mach 0.8; Roll damper usually off when maneouvering. All dampers only active at AOA less than +/- 15 deg
Main AFCS mode is Attitude Hold Mode (Ctrl-t). Other Modes need this main mode activated before being selected. Switching off Attitude Mode disables all other modes.
When in Attitude Mode, the autopilot disengages whenever a certain pressure is put on the stick and it reengages when the stick is back in the center position. Attitude Hold Mode will hold pitch
attitudes up to +/- 30℃ and bank angles up to +/- 60℃;
Altitude Mode (keyboard CTRL-A):
Once in Attitude Mode the AP REF indicator (left of the VDI) illuminates engage at desired altitude keybaord *. The autopilot will then maintain your altitude.
Heading Mode:
Once in Attitude Mode, you can select Heading Mode by hitting Ctrl-h. After manoeuvering the aircraft to the desired reference heading,
release the control stick at a bank angle of less than +/- 5°. The autopilot will then hold the aircraft on the desired Heading.
Autopilot need SAS channels to be engaged (which is the default). SAS Pitch and Roll channels may be disengaged by actuating switches
located on the AFCS panel. With frame rates lower than 17fps you might experience jitter and autopilot may go haywire. In order avoid most
catastrophic cases, parts of pitch SAS will be automatically and temporarely disengaged under 15fps, the same for Autopilot under 10fps.
Automatic Power Control (APC) (keyboard "a" toggle):
APC regulates engine thrust to maintain thean optimum approach angle of attack for landing.
To engage APC, gear must be down, in air, throttles between 98% and 68% rpm (as shown on the panel gauges)
Abnormal disengagement will cause the AUTO THROT caution light on the left side of the HUD to illuminate for 10 seconds.
Wing sweep
Wing sweep can be control automatically or manually with the CADC. When using manual control the auto control be
reactivated when CADC values require more sweep than is demanded by the pilot. Keys: ">" "<" manual sweep; '=' for
auto mode. The mode can be selected by clicking on the indicator on the gauge and position by using the mouse wheel over
the indicator
VHF: Located on the RIO's left console, 3 bands: 30-88 Mhz, 108-174 Mhz, 225-400 Mhz. Modes TR and TR-G set COMM1. Mode DF sets NAV1,
that is Direction Finder displayed with the single needle in both BDHIs. You have Comm *or* DF. Storing frequencies (up to 20 channels) a- PRESET
select the desired chan, b- READ tune the desired frequency, c- LOAD stores the frequency in the previously selected chan.
UHF: Located on the pilot's left console, 225-400 Mhz. ADF is not enabled on this radio.
Displays: HUD: Take Off and Landing mode, Air to Air mode, Cruise mode selectable from the Pilot's Display Panel, down to the right,
buttons in column.
HUD, VDI (Vertical Display Indicator) and HSD (Horisontal Situation Display) turned ON/OFF from the same panel, lowest switches row.

key.name: Ctrl-n
key.desc: Toggle Radar PULSE SRCH / TWS AUTO Modes

key.name: Ctrl-v
key.desc: Select pilot's view (view 0) or toggle between pilot's and RIO's view
Nose wheel steering or Autopilot selected mode

key.name: u
key.desc: Cycle through the 3 refuelling probe switch positions
